nodes.text: LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga
LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga is an upcoming LEGO Star Wars video game developed by Traveller's Tales. It adapts the nine films of the Skywalker saga.

LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga was first announced in an interview with Matthew Wood at Celebration Chicago 2019. The game's story has been overhauled, and the levels redone from LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga  and LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens. The team also introduced new levels, and the game will be fully voiced.

Unlike previous LEGO Star Wars games, the levels in this game will not have to be completed in a linear order. The hub area in the game is now a vast open-world environment that the player can fully explore. Random encounters will appear in the hub relevant to the time that the player is taking part in, and players can choose to engage or disengage in the encounters.[source?]

The game will be released in both a standard edition and deluxe edition. The latter will include a special Darth Vader slipcover, a "Character Collection bundle" (six DLC character packs), and a Luke Skywalker-with-Blue-Milk minifigure. The six DLC packs to be included in the Character Collection bundle will be The Mandalorian Pack 1, The Mandalorian Pack 2, a Rogue One: A Star Wars Story pack, a Classic Characters pack, a Solo: A Star Wars Story pack, and a Star Wars: The Bad Batch pack.
